reference.shortdesc: The sup element indicates that text should appear with superscript highlighting, or vertically raised in relationship to the surrounding text. Superscripts are usually a smaller font than the surrounding text.

section.note: Style sheets can be used to format the sup element differently, just like any other element can be restyled. Thus, it is not the case that content in sup elements will necessarily be rendered as superscript.

example.title: Example
example.codeblock: The power produced by the electrohydraulic dam was 1010 more than the older electric plant. The difference was H2O.
